Subject: monthly premium payments update
Description:
* Inquiry
What is the procedure to change to monthly 
premium payments?

* Answer
Paying your premiums by the month can make it 
easier to manage your budget. You can have 
premiums deducted each month from your credit 
card or nominated bank account. If you wish to 
change from an annual to monthly premium payment, 
download the Direct Debit Request Form, complete 
and return it to us.

Subject: ownership on a policy update
Description:
* Inquiry
How do I name or change ownership on a policy? 

* Answer
Only the owner of an insurance policy or his 
legally designated representative may change 
ownership. If the owner of the policy is a trust, 
signatures and titles of the trustee(s) are required. 
If the owner of the policy is a corporation, only one 
company officer's signature and title is required 
Complete an Ownership Change Request Form.

Subject: joint owners update
Description:
* Inquiry
How can I name joint owners? 

* Answer
To name joint owners, designate whether the 
owners are to share as Joint Tenants With Rights 
of Survivorship or as Tenants in Common Without 
the Right of Survivorship.

Subject: beneficiary update
Description:
* Inquiry
Can I name my child as a beneficiary? 

* Answer
If the policyowner wishes his or her children to 
receive the life insurance proceeds, the children 
themselves should be named; however, because 
benefits are generally not payable to minors, 

we recommend that a trust or custodianship be 
established.

Subject: monthly premium payments update
Description:
* Inquiry
What is the procedure to change to monthly 
premium payments?

* Answer
Paying your premiums by the month can make it 
easier to manage your budget. You can have 
premiums deducted each month from your credit 
card or nominated bank account. If you wish to 
change from an annual to monthly premium payment, 
download the Direct Debit Request Form, complete 
and return it to us.

Subject: ownership on a policy update
Description:
* Inquiry
How do I name or change ownership on a policy? 

* Answer
Only the owner of an insurance policy or his 
legally designated representative may change 
ownership. If the owner of the policy is a trust, 
signatures and titles of the trustee(s) are required. 
If the owner of the policy is a corporation, only one 
company officer's signature and title is required 
Complete an Ownership Change Request Form.

Subject: joint owners update
Description:
* Inquiry
How can I name joint owners? 

* Answer
To name joint owners, designate whether the 
owners are to share as Joint Tenants With Rights 
of Survivorship or as Tenants in Common Without 
the Right of Survivorship.

Subject: beneficiary update
Description:
* Inquiry
Can I name my child as a beneficiary? 

* Answer
If the policyowner wishes his or her children to 
receive the life insurance proceeds, the children 
themselves should be named; however, because 
benefits are generally not payable to minors, 

we recommend that a trust or custodianship be 
established.

* Inquiry
What is the procedure to change to monthly 
premium payments?

* Answer
Paying your premiums by the month can make it 
easier to manage your budget. You can have 
premiums deducted each month from your credit 
card or nominated bank account. If you wish to 
change from an annual to monthly premium payment, 
download the Direct Debit Request Form, complete 
and return it to us.

Subject: due date of changing premium payment method
Description:
* Inquiry
What is the due date to change premium 
payment method?

* Answer
The answer is followings:

Method change request should be submitted 
at least 30 days in advance from the due 
date, for it to be effected.

Description:

* Answer
The policy holder can send a request for a

mentioned document and submitting the same 
to the nearest branch.

- The nomination form duly filled, signed and 
witnessed.

Subject: ownership on a policy update
Description:
* Inquiry
How do I name or change ownership on a policy? 

* Answer
Only the owner of an insurance policy or his 
legally designated representative may change 
ownership. If the owner of the policy is a trust, 
signatures and titles of the trustee(s) are required. 
If the owner of the policy is a corporation, only one 
company officer's signature and title is required 
Complete an Ownership Change Request Form.

Subject: joint owners update
Description:
* Inquiry
How can I name joint owners? 

* Answer
To name joint owners, designate whether the 
owners are to share as Joint Tenants With Rights 
of Survivorship or as Tenants in Common Without 
the Right of Survivorship.

Subject: beneficiary update
Description:
* Inquiry
Can I name my child as a beneficiary? 

* Answer
If the policyowner wishes his or her children to 
receive the life insurance proceeds, the children 
themselves should be named; however, because 
benefits are generally not payable to minors, 

we recommend that a trust or custodianship be 
established.
